snippet: A stunt by an anti-immigration activist sent tourists running for cover, knocking over chairs at restaurants....
abstract: Faux occupation held in Prague's Old Town Square mimics attack by Islamic State militants and startles several tourists in area; stunt was organized by anti-immigration activists with permission from City Hall officials; intent was to heighten public awareness of threat posed by militant group to Czech Republic, but act was quickly shut down when its graphic nature became clear to officials.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and JAN RICHTER

lead_paragraph: A stunt by an anti-immigration activist sent tourists running for cover, knocking over chairs at restaurants.

headline.main: Fake ISIS Attack in Prague, Intended as Protest, Causes Panic
headline.print_headline: A Make-Believe ISIS Attack in Prague Frightens Tourists

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
